Feature: Size often linked to comfort levels in social settings like flights or public transport.
Subtle suggestions of acceptable body sizes for certain public spaces.
Latinos are frequently associated with larger body sizes and needs for more space.
Native Americans and Asians are depicted as quiet and reserved.
Characters are often assessed based on who is seeking government assistance.
Preferences for seating (front vs. back) are tied to personal characteristics like size or hearing ability.
Frequent emphasis on who needs more space in confined areas like airplane seats.
